name: UploadClientCertToProject
description:
Upload a client certificate for mTLS authentication.

Use this tool to upload a client certificate to a Vercel project for mutual TLS (mTLS) authentication with external origins.

parameters.name: project_id_or_name
parameters.description: The unique identifier or name of the Vercel project to upload the client certificate to. This is required to specify which project the mTLS certificate should be associated with.

value_schema.description: The unique project identifier or the project name

parameters.name: team_identifier
parameters.description: The string identifier of the team to perform the request on behalf of.

value_schema.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: team_slug
parameters.description: The slug representing the team on whose behalf the request is made.

value_schema.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: client_certificate_data
parameters.description: JSON object containing the client certificate, private key, certificate authority, and optional origin and validation settings.

cert.description: The client certificate in PEM format

key.description: The private key in PEM format

ca.description: The certificate authority in PEM format

origin.description: The origin this certificate should be used for. If not specified, the certificate will be project-wide.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the vercel API.

parameters.name: teamId
parameters.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

value_schema.description: The Team identifier to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: slug
parameters.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

value_schema.description: The Team slug to perform the request on behalf of.

parameters.name: idOrName
parameters.description: The unique project identifier or the project name

value_schema.description: The unique project identifier or the project name

cert.description: The client certificate in PEM format

key.description: The private key in PEM format

ca.description: The certificate authority in PEM format

origin.description: The origin this certificate should be used for. If not specified, the certificate will be project-wide.
